The first thermistor in the ice was at 1.8 m depth. | depth: Borehole continued 12.2 m into the bed (for a total depth of 59.7 m)
Glacier surged vigorously in 2017-2018 | latitude/longitude/elevation: Measured with single-frequency GPS | Lower ablation area | measurement.depth: Relative to ice surface on 2019-07-04

Glacier is not surge-type | Ice thickness is ~110 m at borehole location | See Wilson 2012 (https://summit.sfu.ca/item/12553) and Wilson 2013 (https://doi.org/10.1002/jgrf.20096) | latitude/longitude/elevation: Measured with single-frequency GPS on 2011-08-02 | measurement.depth: Relative to ice surface on 2011-08 | Central ablation area of small valley glacier

Glacier is surge-type and last surged vigorously in the 1980s. Interpreted to be undergoing a 'slow surge' at the time of temperature measurement | See Wilson 2013 (https://doi.org/10.1002/jgrf.20096) and Flowers 2011 (https://doi.org/10.5194/tc-5-299-2011) | latitude/longitude/elevation: Measured with Trimble RTK survey | Central ablation area of small surge-type valley glacier | measurement.depth: Relative to ice surface on 2011-07-17

Cooling and settling of temperatures after insertion of the sensors not excluded from dataset | Upper sensors affected by radiative heating | See Abermann 2020 (https://doi.org/10.1017/jog.2020.28) | Near an automatic weather station | Measured with PT940 resistance temperature probes on Pace Scientific XR440 data loggers

to_bed: Ice thickness estimated to be 110 m based on radar measurements and increase in large sediment at the bottom of the borehole | measurement.depth: Water filling the hole up to 40 m depth prevented measurements but lack of freezing suggests temperate ice at depth

location_origin: Figure 1 in Suzhodrovsky 1961 (http://geolibrary.ru/sites/default/files/2020-11/IslLedLegnR_1.pdf#page=55). The choice of borehole was based on the description '2 км от центра купола' (2 km from the center of the dome) | elevation_origin: Elevation of Copernicus DEM (https://doi.org/10.5270/ESA-c5d3d65) at location
Firn core with melt layers | measurement_origin: 'unpublished work by R. E. Dalinger, P. Skvarca, and A. J. Aristarain' | location_origin: Figure 1 and elevation | Melt layers present
Firn core with no melt layers | location_origin: Figure 1, elevation, and description '3 km west of the summit'

Accumulation area | Snow and firn | Unclear whether all measurements were made in the same borehole | measurement.depth: Relative to glacier surface in April 2012 (for 2012 profiles) and April 2013 (for 2013 profiles)
location_origin: Same location as 1962 borehole at 4440 m (interpreted as borehole 315 at 4420 m) | ice_depth: Mostly ice from 4 m but firn transition complete at 17 m
Accumulation area | Unclear whether the different profiles where from one or multiple boreholes at the same location

location_origin/elevation_origin: Based only on description 'на вершине купола Вавилова' (on the summit of Vavilov Ice Cap). Cannot be matched to a borehole in Table 1 in Morev 1981 because the first measurement date (1974-05-17) precedes the onset of drilling.

location_origin/elevation_origin: Based on the description for borehole 9 in Table 1 in Morev 1981 as '18-й вехи на северном склоне купола Вавнлова' (18th milestone on the northern slope of the Vavilov Ice Cap) interpreted as 18 km northward from the summit along the summit ridge | depth: Borehole length was 310 m but only 180 m deep due to a strong inclination
